meanings.definition: A thick application of paint on a canvas.
meanings.sent1: The artist used impastos to create a textured surface on the canvas.
meanings.sent2: Impastos give a three-dimensional quality to the painting.
meanings.sent3: The impastos on the canvas made it look like a mini mountain range.
meanings.sent4: Her use of impastos transformed the flat canvas into a sculptural masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The impastos stood out boldly, inviting viewers to touch the painting.

meanings.definition: The technique of applying paint in a thick manner.
meanings.sent1: With impastos, the artist can add depth and richness to the artwork.
meanings.sent2: Impastos require a skilled hand to achieve the desired effect.
meanings.sent3: The painter's impastos were so thick, they almost looked like frosting on a cake.
meanings.sent4: Her impastos were like layers of memories piled on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The impastos seemed to jump off the canvas, creating a tactile experience.

meanings.definition: The texture or effect created by using impastos in painting.
meanings.sent1: The impastos added a rough texture to the painting, enhancing its visual appeal.
meanings.sent2: Impastos can create a sense of movement and energy in the artwork.
meanings.sent3: The impastos gave the painting a bumpy, almost popcorn-like surface.
meanings.sent4: Her use of impastos produced a dramatic contrast between light and shadow.
meanings.sent5: The impastos made the painting look like a frozen moment in time.
